name: Gov. Henry McMaster

name: Gov. Henry McMaster
tweet: While other states went too far in their COVID lockdowns and restrictions, we never closed. South Carolina took a different approach and didn't designate which jobs were essential and non-essential because to every person and their family, their job is essential.  https://t.co/wThopvpebC

tweet: There continues to be no evidence to support the necessity of closing schools due to COVID. Every school district in South Carolina needs to be open five days a week for full time face-to-face instruction!  https://t.co/uBfg1XEjfM

name: Gov. Henry McMaster
tweet: Effective March 31st 2021, South Carolinians aged 16 and older will be eligible to receive the COVID-19 vaccine.Thanks to the tremendous efforts of our state‚Äôs health care professionals, we are now able to make the vaccine available to anyone who wants it.

name: Gov. Henry McMaster
tweet: Making the COVID-19 vaccine available in our rural areas is critical for our vaccination efforts in South Carolina. name: Gov. Henry McMaster

name: Gov. Henry McMaster
tweet: I encourage those who have recovered from COVID-19 to sign up to donate plasma, it will save a life!

name: Gov. Henry McMaster
tweet: The science is clear, teachers can safely return to the classroom before getting vaccinated. The fact is, the classroom is one of the safest places you can be amid COVID-19.  https://t.co/fl64SlR3NN

name: Gov. Henry McMaster
tweet: There is no argument, our older population are more susceptible to dying from COVID-19. It is unethical and immoral to put someone who is likely not going to die from the virus, in front of someone who will!  https://t.co/G3sJHnOzwX

name: Gov. Henry McMaster

name: Gov. Henry McMaster
tweet: We‚Äôve got the jobs. We have the people. Now, especially after COVID, we need to make sure those people are trained and ready to meet the needs of existing and future industry.

name: Gov. Henry McMaster
tweet: 2020 provided not only South Carolina, but the world, a set of unique and difficult challenges. I'm proud of the way South Carolinians rose to the challenge and did what they needed to do to fight COVID-19 and keep our economy afloat.

name: Gov. Henry McMaster
tweet: Due to a dramatic acceleration in vaccine usage we have seen in the last week, we have decided to speed things up again. Those 70 and older are at the greatest risk of dying from COVID-19. Making sure they have faster access to the vaccine will help save lives in South Carolina.

name: Gov. Henry McMaster
tweet: Starting this Wednesday, Jan. 13th, South Carolina residents aged 70 or over, regardless of health status or pre-existing conditions, can begin to schedule their appointments to receive the COVID-19 vaccine.
